issue.title: Abnormal Error for event-chunk

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For bugs or requests that have already been made and are currently open.

issue.body:
### Skript/Server Version

```markdown
[Skript] Skript's aliases can be found here: https://github.com/SkriptLang/skript-aliases
[Skript] Skript's documentation can be found here: https://docs.skriptlang.org/
[Skript] Skript's tutorials can be found here: https://docs.skriptlang.org/tutorials
[Skript] Server Version: git-Paper-477 (MC: 1.19.4)
[Skript] Skript Version: 2.7.0-beta2 (skriptlang-github)
[Skript] Installed Skript Addons: None
[Skript] Installed dependencies: None
```


### Bug Description

When using `event-chunk` directly in a chunk event, it throws a duplicated and unintended error.
This error does not throw when the chunk is saved into a variable then use that variable.

### Expected Behavior

It should not throw and duplicate error.

### Steps to Reproduce

Use and reload this script used on this issue:
```v
on chunk load:
    set {_c} to event-chunk
    set {_e::*} to entities in {_c}
    set {_e::*} to entities in event-chunk

on chunk unload:
    set {_c} to event-chunk
    set {_e::*} to entities in {_c}
    set {_e::*} to entities in event-chunk
```

### Errors or Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/SkriptLang/Skript/assets/72163224/ef2e248a-e2de-423c-a559-0705ca4499a9)


### Other

_No response_

### Agreement

- [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this report.

labels.name: priority: medium

issue.body: ### Bug Description ```vb on chunk unload: clear all dropped item in event-chunk clear all entities of type dropped item in event-chunk ``` ### Expected Behavior To not error and allow me to use event-chunk ### Steps to Reproduce add the above code and reload the script ### Errors or Screenshots ### Other The syntax and the event value exists. ### Agreement - [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this report.

comment.body: Duplicate of #5720 but looks like it got lefted out 😬

issue.title: Cannot delete entities within chunk

labels.name: bug
labels.description: An issue that needs to be fixed. Alternatively, a PR fixing an issue.
Targeting a 2.7.X version release

issue.body: ### Bug Description ```vb on chunk unload: clear all dropped item in event-chunk clear all entities of type dropped item in event-chunk ``` ### Expected Behavior To not error and allow me to use event-chunk ### Steps to Reproduce add the above code and reload the script ### Errors or Screenshots ### Other The syntax and the event value exists. ### Agreement - [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this report.

comment.body:
Interestingly I also get double error messages when recreating in 2.7.1:
```
[01:16:34 INFO]: Line 31: (test-folder\test.sk)
[01:16:34 INFO]:     event-chunk is not a world
[01:16:34 INFO]:     Line: clear all dropped items in event-chunk
[01:16:34 INFO]:
[01:16:34 INFO]: Line 31: (test-folder\test.sk)
[01:16:34 INFO]:     event-chunk is not a world
[01:16:34 INFO]:     Line: clear all dropped items in event-chunk
[01:16:34 INFO]:
[01:16:34 INFO]: Line 32: (test-folder\test.sk)
[01:16:34 INFO]:     event-chunk is not a world
[01:16:34 INFO]:     Line: clear all entities of type dropped item in event-chunk
[01:16:34 INFO]:
[01:16:34 INFO]: Line 32: (test-folder\test.sk)
[01:16:34 INFO]:     event-chunk is not a world
[01:16:34 INFO]:     Line: clear all entities of type dropped item in event-chunk
[01:16:34 INFO]:
```

```
on chunk unload:
	clear all dropped items in event-chunk
	clear all entities of type dropped item in event-chunk
```

```
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Skript's aliases can be found here: https://github.com/SkriptLang/skript-aliases
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Skript's documentation can be found here: https://docs.skriptlang.org/
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Skript's tutorials can be found here: https://docs.skriptlang.org/tutorials
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Server Version: git-Paper-164 (MC: 1.20.1)
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Skript Version: 2.7.1 (skriptlang-github)
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Installed Skript Addons: None
[01:17:26 INFO]: [Skript] Installed dependencies: None
```
Yes. We cannot be changing the order every commit between developers.

pull_request.title: Fix issues with ExprDrops
pull_request.body:
### Description
<!--- Describe your changes here. --->

fixed setting drops to multiple items/experience values at once only being set to the last value.
fixed null values being left in drops after removing items, causing errors when getting drops afterwards.
maintained behavior but behavior needs a big update. ExprDrops should not handle Experience, ExprExperience should. To be changed in 2.8.
added JUnit tests, but the death event doesn't have a way to check the dropped experience amount as far as I can see.

Updated javadocs for ItemType#removeFrom() to reflect its behavior better.

---
**Target Minecraft Versions:** any <!-- 'any' means all supported versions -->
**Requirements:** none <!-- Required plugins, server software... -->
**Related Issues:** none <!-- Links to related issues -->

labels.description: An issue that needs to be fixed. Alternatively, a PR fixing an issue.

review.body:
`within a to b` doesn't make sense to me. I can't think of or find any examples where `to` is appropriate to use in this situation; I can only think of `within 1 to 2 days` which is a completely different meaning.

Please let me know if there are legitimate uses of this phrasing outside of Skript, because I can't find any.

pull_request.title: add to to within
pull_request.body: Add `to` to within. Follows the SkQuery syntax which can be removed from SkQuery after this. I always use `to` as SkQuery is way older than the within syntax in Skript.

review.body:
I'm fine with this change. I think mushroom cow is a perfectly fine name to use and I've been tripped up by this before.

However, this change makes `mushroom` a valid alias for mooshrooms which is not acceptable.

review.body: This conflicts with ExprNamed when trying to use `a chest named "test"`. It's now an inventory instead of an item. Just leave `inventory` in the syntax, there's no need to change it.

pull_request.title: Make the "inventory" word optional in ExprChestInventory
pull_request.body:
### Description
Make inventory word optional in ExprChestInventory.
When Snow and I discussed and added the inventory creation syntaxes a long time ago. We made the `inventory` part of the syntax mandatory to avoid conflicts with addons such as Umbaska, WildSkript, SkQuery and Skellett.

Of those addons that are active, being SkQuery and Skellett, have had their inventory syntaxes removed for creating inventories. Skript is the new standard for making inventories, and is currently the most common way to make inventories.

Users in Discord skript-help today as of posting this, were wondering why the word `inventory` was mandatory. I answered them and we were waiting until a decent amount of time had passed to apply this change. That time is now.

---
**Target Minecraft Versions:** any <!-- 'any' means all supported versions -->
**Requirements:** none <!-- Required plugins, server software... -->
**Related Issues:** none <!-- Links to related issues -->

pull_request.title: Allow multiple hashtags to start comments at the beginning of a line.
pull_request.body:
### Description
<!--- Describe your changes here. --->
Any number of hashtags can be used to begin a comment, if and only if they are at the beginning of a line.

All of the comments here are comments.
```sk
# hello comment 1
## hello comment 2
broadcast "ok ## hashtag"
broadcast "ok" # comment
###### comment
# ## comment
```

The following would not be a comment since it does not begin a line.
```sk
broadcast "hello" ## NOT A COMMENT
```


---
**Target Minecraft Versions:** any <!-- 'any' means all supported versions -->
**Requirements:** none <!-- Required plugins, server software... -->
**Related Issues:** #1211 <!-- Links to related issues -->

pull_request.title: Fix issues with ExprDrops
pull_request.body:
### Description
<!--- Describe your changes here. --->

fixed setting drops to multiple items/experience values at once only being set to the last value.
fixed null values being left in drops after removing items, causing errors when getting drops afterwards.
maintained behavior but behavior needs a big update. ExprDrops should not handle Experience, ExprExperience should. To be changed in 2.8.
added JUnit tests, but the death event doesn't have a way to check the dropped experience amount as far as I can see.

Updated javadocs for ItemType#removeFrom() to reflect its behavior better.

---
**Target Minecraft Versions:** any <!-- 'any' means all supported versions -->
**Requirements:** none <!-- Required plugins, server software... -->
**Related Issues:** none <!-- Links to related issues -->

issue.title: impossible command parameter definition error

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Feature request, an issue about something that could be improved, or a PR improving something.

labels.name: priority: low
labels.description: Issues that are not harmful to the experience but are related to useful changes or additions.

issue.body:
### Suggestion

Add a warning or better an error stating that the user cannot use another parameter after an optional text parameter. Example
```
command /example [<text>] [<text>] [<player>]
```
As Skript will parse everything in the command as one argument if the player is not online.

### Why?

Skript cannot properly define the difference between the requested types, so Skript should error stating that the user should place the player argument before the text parameters.

### Other

This issue is also present when it comes to string and string as two parameter types in Functions. See any test runner results for a present error representation.

Issue reported in SkUnity help Discord.

### Agreement

- [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this suggestion.

comment.body:
I really don't think this should error. Users should be responsible for checking the validity of their arguments, so checking if arg-3 is set is a perfectly valid way to handle this. Erroring here would lock users out of existing command structures that they may have been using for a while (and I certainly do), for no real reason in my opinion. A warning may make sense for certain types, like player, where their parsing depends on factors outside of the command, but this certainly isn't the case for all parameters. This warning would also require a config option to switch off, as the user may have many valid reasons for putting a non-text argument after a text argument.

For example, should this have a warning/error?
```
command persona <action:text> [<persona:text>] [to <player>] [with colour <text>]:
```
I have a non-text after a text, but it's hardly in danger of causing parsing issues.

To sum up, I think this is a very small benefit for a lot of arduous effort avoiding edge cases and false positives, plus going as far as to error would start causing breaking changes and limit the functionality of Skript commands for no good reason.

issue.title: Falling Block comparator to ItemType

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: Feature request, an issue about something that could be improved, or a PR improving something.

labels.name: priority: lowest

issue.body:
### Suggestion

Add a comparator for allowing `event-falling block is sand or gravel`

### Why?

Easier than needing to type out `event-falling block is falling sand or falling gravel`

### Other

_No response_

### Agreement

- [X] I have read the guidelines above and affirm I am following them with this suggestion.
